definition: (say) a few words
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse
variant of 勾[gou1]
in a few words (idiom); expressed succinctly

sentences.english: And it means basically the same thing.
sentences.chinese: 这两句的意思基本是一致的。

sentences.english: Henry's date was very laconic, saying two sentences the entire evening.
sentences.chinese: 亨利的约会十分简洁，整晚他只说了两句话。

sentences.english: Henry's date was very laconic, only saying two sentences the entire evening.
sentences.chinese: 亨利的约会十分简洁，整晚他只说了两句话。

sentences.english: Jade chatted, class of chemistry and mathematics teacher Zheng Kun walked into the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 刚聊了两句，班玉任兼数学化学老师郑坤走进了教室。

sentences.english: How about selecting a Bible verse or two to fit Father's Day?
sentences.chinese: 选择一两句圣诗来渲染父亲节的气氛怎么样呢？

sentences.english: Oh, well let me defend this old word bench.
sentences.chinese: 哦，还是让我来替这个单词说两句公道话吧。

sentences.english: Had clever trick he said this sentence or two tell you get a vehicle you go looking for him.
sentences.chinese: 曾聪明骗他说这一句两句说不清你快上车带你去找他。

sentences.english: P.S. I added the last two sentences shortly after originally posting the item.
sentences.chinese: 最初发布项目后，我添加了最后两句。

sentences.english: Let me end today by questioning two clichés in particular.
sentences.chinese: 在今天的最后，请允许我对两句陈辞滥调提出质疑。

sentences.english: Can sing the first? next time you hear himself sing well? baby.
sentences.chinese: 能先唱这两句先吗？下次亲自唱你听好不好呀？宝贝。

sentences.english: On rare occasions, I will respond almost immediately to your e-mail with a one-to-two-word response. Here is a guide to those responses
sentences.chinese: 我几乎不会用一两句话立即回复你的电子邮件。

sentences.english: You definitely haven't heard of a well-recited poem.
sentences.chinese: 那你肯定没听过两句著名的诗。
苹果公司为此发布了两句话的声明。

sentences.english: A summary statement is a one- to two-sentence overview that captures the essence of your skills and experience.
sentences.chinese: 概述是用一两句话来彰显你技能和经验的精华。

sentences.english: I want to just talk a little bit about his estimate.
sentences.chinese: 关于他的估算我想多说两句。

sentences.english: Would you please send my words to the girl sitting besides you?
sentences.chinese: 请把这两句话转告给你旁边的那个女孩子好吗？

variant of 勾[gou1]
a line of verse/a sentence
(speak) without thinking the matter through
to read smoothly (of text)/to blurt out (without thinking)/to suit one's taste (of food)
conventional greeting/polite formula
in the end
witticism/wisecrack/sarcastic remark/double entendre
friendly advice/words spoken on sb's behalf/a good word/kind words/words that sound fine but are not followed up with actions
to read smoothly (of text)/to blurt out (without thinking)/to suit one's taste (of food)
words/speech/utterance/discourse
polite phrase/conventional greetings/cliché/to try to worm facts out of sb
casual conversation/chat/gossip/to talk about (whatever comes to mind)
in a word/in short
words of politeness/politesse/decorous talking/talk with propriety
words and sentences
in a low voice/(speak) in whispers
